articles.title: TRPA1 and TRPV4 mediate paclitaxel-induced peripheral neuropathy in mice via a glutathione-sensitive mechanism
results: Paclitaxel → cold and mecha hypersensitivity
Paclitaxel → CGRP release (sensory peptide implicated in pain)
GSH (antioxidant) → paclitaxel do not increases CGRP release
TRPA1 and/or TRPV4 antagonists → decrease of paclitaxel-evoked CGRP release
articles.notes: Paclitaxel also triggers mechanical allodynia

models: CHO cells transfected with mTRPA1, rTRPV4, hTRPV1 or mTRPM8
DRG cells (from WT and Trpa1-/- Wistar rats)
results: H2O2 or lipid peroxidation products or 15dPGJ2 → TRPA1 opens → [Ca2+]i increase (H2O2 dose-dependent)
Explained at least partly by OH• production
articles.notes: Pas d'effet consistant sur TRPV1, TRPV4 et TRPM8 dans cet article

results: CHPx or H2O2 → Increased current through TRPM8
GSH → the current decrease
articles.notes: Aussi des résultats sur intégrité mitochondriale et apoptose

results: H2O2 → TRPM8 overexpression + [Ca2+]i increase

articles.title: Oxaliplatin-induced neuropathy in the rat: involvement of oxalate in cold hyperalgesia but not mechanical allodynia
techniques: Acetone test and cold-plate test (cold hyperalgesia)
results: Oxaliplatin (oxalate) → cold hyperalgesia but no mechanical allodynia
Vincristine → dose dependent tactile allodynia but no thermal allodynia (heat)
articles.notes: They only test for heat sensitivity but not cold sensitivity

results: Doxorubicin → sciatic nerve lesion → cold allodynia
NAC and/or histidine → decrease of doxorubicin-induced lesions and allodynia + increase of TAC + decrease of MDA
articles.notes: Pas trouvé d'articles sur doxorubicin + TRP sur PubMed

results: Epirubucin + docetaxel → cold allodynia (reduced by duloxetine + allopregnanolone)
articles.notes: Article fortement résumé ici, mais le reste semble moins intéressant pour l'instant dans le contexte du stage

models: Wistar rats (model of 5-FU induced oral ulcerative mucositis)
results: 5-FU seul → no enhanced nociception in the oral mucosa
articles.notes: Article qui porte surtout sur les douleurs d'ulcères buccaux, le résultat rapporté est celui qui nous intéresse principalement pour l'instant. Human TRPA1 is sensitive to acid and insensitive to cold stimulation, in contrast to rodent TRPA1

results: Calcium channel blockers → reduction of oxaliplatin-induced acute pain (but not chronic pain)
articles.notes: In the study using rats treated with oxaliplatin, we demonstrated that oxalate and platinum metabolites are involved in the cold hyperalgesia

articles.title: Paclitaxel therapy potentiates cold hyperalgesia in streptozotocin-induced diabetic rats through enhanced mitochondrial reactive oxygen species production and TRPA1 sensitization
results: Paclitaxel → cold allodynia + increased H2O2 production + increased complex I activity + decreased GPX4 expression + no effect on Trpa1 nor Nav1.9 expression
NAC or HC030031 (TRPA1 inhibitor) → decrease of paclitaxel-induced cold sensitivity
articles.notes: ATTENTION : la plupart des résultats rapportés viennent d'une analyse visuelle des figures mais les stats dans l'article portent sur une comparaison entre rats diabétiques et non diabétiques sous paclitaxel

techniques: TRPA1 mutations: C633S, C641S, C665S or P394A
results: Oxaliplatin (1mM but not 0.1 nor 0.3 mM) → increased whole cell current and [Ca2+]i but no increase of TRPA1 opening probability
GSH → oxaliplatin do not increases [Ca2+]i
C641S mutation → decreases oxaliplatin-induced [Ca2+]I increase
P394A mutation → no effect on oxaliplatin-induced Ca2+ influx
articles.notes: ARTICLE QUI EST VRAIMENT SUR LA MEME IDEE QUE LE SUJET DE STAGE. Si diminution [O2], diminution de l'activité des prolyl hydroxylases (PHDs) donc résidu Pro394 est moins hydroxylé, ce qui active donc le canal en condition d'hypoxie

results: H2O2 → TRPV1 sensitization via inter-cysteine disulfide bonds within its cytoplasmic termini

articles.title: Transient Receptor Potential Vanilloid 1 is essential for cisplatin-induced heat hyperalgesia in mice
results: Oxaliplatin → cold and mechanical but no heat hypersensitivity
Cisplatin → Heat and mechanical hypersensitivity but no cold sensitivity
In DRG: Cisplatin or oxaliplatine → increased TRPV1, TRPA1 and TRPM8 expression
In TG: Cisplatin → increased TRPA1 and TRPV1 expression, Oxaliplatin → increased TRPA1 expression
Paclitaxel → increased TRPA1 expression + increased whole cell current + increased TRPA1 opening proba + increased Ca2+ entry
H89 (inh PKA) ou CHEL (inh PKC) → decrease of paclitaxel-induced Ca2+ entry (WOR, a PI3K inhibitor, has no effect)

models: DRG neurons (Sprague-Dawley rats: neuropathic pain model by vincristine sulfate injection)
results: Vincristine (chronic treatment) → thermal and mecanical allodynia + increased TRPV1 expression via TNF-a increased synthesis + increased whole cell current
Vincristine (chronic treatment) → mecanical allodynia + increased TRPV1 level (but not TRPV2) + increased TRPV1 mRNA, mainly in small diameter DRG

models: Mice chronically injected with vincristin sulfate (neuropathic pain model)
results: Vincristin (chronic) → thermal and mechanical allodynia + decrease of GSH, GST and SOD levels and increase of Cat, MDA, MPO in ACC, insular cortex, amygdala, PAG, lombar SC and sciatic nerve + increase of cytokines and NO levels in these regions + histophathological alterations of sciatic nerve, spinal chord, hippocampus and cortex + DNA dammage + increase of TRPV1, TRPM8, P2Y receptors, JNK, ERK, p38, Bax and caspase-3 mRNA + decrease of Bcl2
Withametelin or gabapentin (neuroprotectors) → cancel vincristin effects
articles.notes: Augmentation de la transcription de TRPV1 via voie p38-MAPK. JNK active caspase 3 et inhibe Bcl-2 → apoptose. Withameline se lie à casp-3 > TRPV1 > p38 > P2Y > TRPM8 > JNK

models: Wistar rats (injected with vincristine, neuropathic pain model)
results: Vincristine → increased sensitivity to heat and tactile stimuli + weight loss + decreased sciatic nerve conduction (demyelination and degeneration) + increase in TRPA1 but not TRPV1 levels + increase in proinflammatory cytokines level
Modafinil or gabapentin (neuroprotector) → cancel vincristine effects
articles.notes: Les effets de la vincristine passeraient donc plus par TRPA1 que par TRPV1 (le taux de TRPV1 en WB ne diminue pas significativement en condition vincristine par rapport au contrôle)

results: Bortezomib → increases cold and mechanical allodynia + increase in TNF-a, TNFR1 and TRPA1 levels + no increase in total p38-MAPK and JNK level but increase of their phorphorylated form
HC030031 (inh TRPA1) or PTX (inh TNF-a) → decrease cold/mecha sensitivity (dose dependant effect)
PTX → cancel bortezomib influence on TRPA1, TNF-a, TNFR1, p38-MAPK and JNK levels/phosphorylation
articles.notes: On sait que TNF-a peut activer TRPA1 via la voie MAPK

results: Bortezomib → increased cold and mechanical allodynia + increased IL-6, IL-6R and TRPA1 level + increase in p38-MAPK and JNK phosphorylated forms but not in total protein amount
SC144 (IL-6R inh) → decreases bortezomib effect on IL-6, IL-6R, TRPA1, p38-MAPK and JNK
articles.notes: Même article que le 20 (manips, forme) mais avec IL-6 au lieu de TNF-a

models: Wistar rats (chronic or acute BTZ injection) DRG
results: BTZ → no change in weight + mechanical allodynia + increased TRPV1 expression in DRG (chronic and acute treatment) and spinal cord (chronic treatment only) + decrease of TRPV1 mRNA levels in DRG (chronic treatment only) and of CGPR mRNA in DRG and spinal cord (chronic treatment only) + sciatic nerve axonopathy (affecting mostly small myelinated and unmyelinated fibers
articles.notes: CGPR = sensory peptide

models: 69 year-old man with multiple myelomma, treated with bortezomib
techniques: Le patient a développé des douleurs neuropathiques et les traitements classiques opioids, gabapentine, pregabalin et ketamine avaient trop d'effets secondaires. Donc utilisation de crème au menthol, évaluation 90 minutes et 2 semaines
results: Menthol → No reduction in global pain score, but decrease of mechanical allodynia (the patient had no thermal allodynia) at t+90min
articles.notes: Article sous forme de communication rapide. Bortezomib is a proteasome inhibitor

models: Sprague-Dawley rats + mice (WT, Trpa1-/-, Trpv4-/-, Trpv1-/-) DRG
techniques: Intraplantal (i.pl.) or intrathecal (i.th., spinal cord) injections to see peripheral and central channels implication
results: Thalidomide → cold and mechanical but no heat hypersensitivity, decreased by i.pl. HC03 or i.th. HC06 (respectively selective TRPA1 and TRPV4 antagonists) (they both have an the same effect via i.p. injection) or by deletion of TRPA1 and TRPV4 or by PBN. + Triggers no current in TRPA1 and TRPV4 positive DRG. + oxidative stress in hind paw, sciatic nerve and lumbar spinal cord
H2O2 → Ca2+ dose-dependant response in TRPV4 and TRPA1 (h & m) HEK, inhibited by HC03 but not HC06 (for low [H2O2]
PBN (ROS scavenger) or catalase (H2O2-detoxifying enzyme) → partially reduce thalidomide-induced mechanical allodynia when injected i.pl. or i.th. (if both injections, cancel thalimide effect)
articles.notes: → L'allodynie observée implique donc les canaux TRPA1 périphériques et TRPV4 centraux. Voir l'article (fig 5) pour la localisation plus précise des récepteurs. Les auteurs disent que l'effet de PBN (ROS scavenger) n'est pas direct puisque PBN ne change pas le courant mesuré en présence d'agoniste de TRPA1 et TRPV4 (→ pourquoi ne pas avoir testé sans les agonistes, pour voir si un courant apparaissait ?)

results: Paclitaxel → Mechanical hyperalgesia, partially reversed by AMG9810 (TRPV1 antagonist) + increase of the TRPV1-positive cell percentage (exept in presence of TLR4 antag) + Increase of DRG resting potential, decrease of rhéobase and AP amplitude + Prevent TRPV1 desensitization to capsaicin in DRG, and in HEK cells coexpriming TRPV1 and TLR4 (even increase the current compared to first capsaicin application), but not in Trpv1+/+/ Tlr4-/- HEK cells. + Increased EPSCs frequency (at day 7), exept in presence of TRPV1 antagonist AMG9810 (only a small increase in presence of TLR4 antagonist LPS)
LPS (TLR4 antagonist) → no paclitaxel-induced incease of TRPV1-positive cells
articles.notes: ARTICLE TRES INTERESSANT A RELIRE EN DETAIL (chronic ou online, time after paclitaxel treatment, cell diversity...). Autre resultat : TRP1 et TLR4 sont colocalisés (mais pas systématiquement) dans les petits neurones DRG humains et murins. /!"In naive rats, acute application of neither LPS nor paclitaxel induced increases in spontaneous action potentials" → they had to incubate their cells with LPS or paclitaxel before testing for acute online effect. Note that elecrophysiological experiments were done at different time point after paclitaxel treatment → MAY BE INTERESTING ABOUT THE DURATION OF PACLITAXEL EFFECTS.

models: DRG neurons from untreated Wistar rats
results: Cisplatin or oxaliplatin → Increases ROS production, mitochondrial stress, cytosolic and mitochondrial [Ca2+] in TRPV1- or/and TRPA1-positive cells
ROS production dynamic differs according to the cell type (TRPV1- or TRPA1-positive) AND the drug (CIS or OXAL)
articles.notes: Plus de détails sur la production de ROS induite par les drogues

results: GSH → Prevent oxaliplatin- or cisplatin-induced intracellular [Ca2+] increase

Oxaliplatin → Mecha hypersensitivity, which is decreased by HC-03 (TRPA1 antag) but not by CPZ (TRPV1 antag) (this difference is visible 60 min after antagonist injection) + Cold hypersensitivity, except if KO TRPA1 + Increase of TRPA1 mRNA
Cisplatin → mechanical hypersensitivity, except for TRPA1 KO
articles.notes: Pour les taux de Ca2+, plus de cellules répondent à oxaliplatine qu'à cisplatine. Interessant dans l'article : on a les mesures de douleur au moment du traitement avec antagoniste TRPA1 et V1 mais aussi 30, 60, 120 et 180 minutes après le traitement

articles.title: Oxaliplatin-induced cold hypersensitivity is due to remodelling of ion channel expression in nociceptors
results: Oxaliplatin → cold hypersensitivity, canceled by TRPM8 KO + mecha hypersensitivity, not reversed by TRPM8 KO + Increase of TRPA1 but not TRPM8 mRNA levels
HC-03 (TRPA1 blocker) → no effect on oxaliplatin-induced cold intolerance (pain behavior ie jumps), but decreases OXAL-induced mechanical hypersensitivity
No direct effect of OXAL on TRPM8
articles.notes: Donne aussi l'effet de l'oxaliplatine sur l'expression d'autres canaux (TREK, TRAAK, Kv1.1, Nav1.8, HCN1, HCN2, HCN3, HCN4) et montre qu'ils sont importants dans l'hypersensibilité due à l'oxaliplatine. Voir schema de la figure 10 qui spécifie l'implication différente de ces canaux dans les différentes formes d'allodynie

models: SH-SY5Y cells expressing TRPV1 (10h incubation with docetaxel)
techniques: Apoptosis, cell viability, caspase-3 and -9 assays
results: Docetaxel → Thermal and mechanical allodynia + [Ca2+]i and TRPV1 current increase + apoptosis + increased lipid peroxidation, GSH levels + decrease of total antioxidant status + increase of TRPV1 protein level
Melatonin or Selenium → Decrease or reverse of docetaxel-induced effects
articles.notes: Melatonin and selenium inhibit TRPV1, which prevent docetaxel effect (increased TRPV1 expression, current, Ca entry, decrease of antioxidant status...)

models: C57BL/6N mice models of cisplatin- and paclitaxel-induced CNIP
techniques: In vivo silencing of specific sensory fibers + intradermal, intraperitoneal or intrathecal PBN administration
results: Cisplatin or paclitaxel → mechanical hypersensitivity
PBN → only intradermal (paw) and intraperitoneal (systemic) PBN decrease mecha hypersensitivity + Only intrathecal (spinal cord) and i.p. PBN decrease mecha hypersensitivity
articles.notes: Cisplatin-induced mechanical hypersensitivity is attributed to peripheral oxidative stress sensitizing mechanical nociceptors, whereas paclitaxel-induced mechanical hypersensitivity is due to central (spinal) oxidative stress maintaining central sensitization that abnormally produces pain in response to Aβ fiber inputs

results: H2O2 → activates capsaicin-sensitive afferents
HC-03 (TRPA1 inh) → prevent H202-induced activation
Capsazepine (inh TRPV1) or TRPM8 inh → no reduction of H2O2-induced current

articles.title: Effects of Oxaliplatin on Facial Sensitivity to Cool Temperatures and TRPM8 Expressing Trigeminal Ganglion Neurons in Mice
models: TG from Trpm8-/+ SKH1 mice (2 OXAL injections)
results: Paclitaxel or oxaliplatin → increased current (at all tested voltage) in TRPM8 positive TG cells, through Nav (explained by a change in the channel conductance more than by the number of channels) + change in whole cell TRPM8 or HCN currents (but no conductance tested or no change in conductance, respectively)
articles.notes: Permet de justifier que, malgré le fait que la plupart des études portent sur l'expression et non les courants, on s'attend à avoir un effet de l'oxaliplatine sur l'ouverture de TRPM8 (et pas uniquement sur son expression)

results: TRPM8 Popen increases with the membrane potential and shift to the left (increased Popen at low voltages) when its cold
articles.notes: TRPM8 current caracterization (see figures) + kinetics of TRPM8 activation by voltage and cold. C'est un papier de l'équipe. /!\Remarque de George : ici ils ont trouvé beaucoup d'états différents pour la cinétique MAIS George a réussi à avoir des modèles plus parcimonieux en patchant dans les 2h qui suivent l'induction de l'expression de TPM8

articles.title: Oxaliplatin Causes Transient Changes in TRPM8 Channel Activity
results: Oxaliplatin → decrease or increase of menthol-induced (TRPM8) Ca2+ current in DRG 24h or 1h (respectively) after OXAL treatment. BUT no impact on TRPV1, TRPA1, TRPM3 or P2X3 Ca2+ currents 24h after OXAL treatment + Decrease of [PIP2], especially when TRPM8 is expressed
PLC or PKC inhibitors (HEK) → prevent the oxaliplatin-induced decrease in TRPM8 Ca2+ current (24h after OXAL treatment)
articles.notes: Inhibition of the PLC pathway reverse the oxaliplatin-induced desensitization of TRPM8 Ca2+ current 24h after oxaliplatin treatment. Bon indicateur que, peut être, OXAL agit sur le courant unitaire TRPM8 (figure 1D) en plus d'augmenter l'expression du canal

results: Capsaicin → Decrease of SOD-2 activity (reversed by ROS scavengers) + mechanical secondary hyperalgesia
MnTBAP (SOD mimetic) or TEMPOL (ROS scavenger) → reduction of capsaicin-induced secondary hyperalgesia
DETC (SOD inhibitor) or SOD-2 KO → increase of capsaicin-induced secondary hyperalgesia
articles.notes: Dans abstract : superoxide est considéré comme le ROS neuronal principal. Primary hyperalgesia: caused by peripheral sensitization (injection site), Secondary hyperalgesia: caused by central sensitization (site distant from the capsaicin injection one)

results: OXAL → cold allodynia + increased TRPM8 mRNA level (peak: 3days after injection)
Capsazepine → reduce OXAL-induced allodynia (dose dependant) (it's not true with 5-iodoresiniferatoxin, selective TRPV1 blocker)
articles.notes: Article très court qui résume des résultats d'autres articles. Ils citent des articles pour argumenter que le timecourse des allodynies mécaniques et thermales ne sont pas identiques (suite à single OXAL injection: pic cold allodynia à d3, pic mecanical allodynia à d10) et que donc peut être que les mécanismes sont différents

results: Paclitaxel or Vincristine → mechanical allodynia and hyperalgesia, decreased by EGTA, Quin-2 (Ca2+ chelators, extracellular actions), TMB8 (Ca2+ and Na+ channel blocker) which all decreased Ca2+ availability
articles.notes: L'effet du paclitaxel et de la vincristine est réduit si on rend le Ca2+ intra- et extracellulaire moins disponible

results: OXAL (acute 2.05 or 5.14 uM) → No Ca2+ increase 100 sec after bath application in SH-SY5Y (no TRP expression in these cells) and DRG cells
OXAL (24h incubation) → altered Ca2+ signalling in SH-SY5Y cells, partly because ER Ca2+ stocks are more important
articles.notes: Acute oxaliplatin, contrary to longer incubation, did not induced abnormal Ca2+ signalling. Cela laisse penser que les TRP ne sont pas activés par l'oxaliplatine. 2.05 µM est une concentration thérapeutique selon l'article. Teste différentes concentrations d'oxaliplatine, en acute ou incubation. To avoid binding of oxaliplatin to seum protein, the cells were incubated with OXAL in serum-free culture media

techniques: Calcium imaging with various TRP agonists
results: OXAL (acute) → increase sensitivity to capsaicin (ie increased answer to the second capsaicin application instead of the desensitization observed without OXAL) but no increase of cell sensitivity to WS12 (TRPM8 agonist)
articles.notes: Acute oxaliplatin sensitize TRPV1 but not TRPM8. Donc peut être qu'on observera pas d'effet acute de l'OXAL sur le courant TRPM8 mais qu'on en observera sur TRPV1 ?

articles.title: An animal model of oxaliplatin-induced cold allodynia reveals a crucial role for Nav1.6 in peripheral pain pathways
models: KO C57BL mice, single intraplantar injection of oxaliplatin or its metabolites (oxalate, Pt(DACH)Cl2) or various channels inhibitors
results: Oxaliplatin (1.6-2 mg/kg) → dose dependant cold allodynia (for t° below 15°C, within minutes after injection, lasting 7 days max) + mecha allodynia (1h & 24h post injection) + no hot allodynia + no spontaneous pain upon injection
Oxalate or Pt(DACH)Cl2 (2.5 mM) → no allodynia
Oxalate (150 mM) or BAPTA (Ca2+ chelator, as oxalate also is) → Mechan allodynia + spontaneous post-injection pain + no cold allodynia
TTX (3 μM) → prevent cold allodynia
KO TRPM8 or TRPA1 or TRPC5 or Nav1.8 or Nav1.9 or Nav1.3 or ProTxII → still oxal-triggered allodynia
GIIIA 10 μM (inh Nav1.1 & 1.6) → Reverse oxal-induced cold allodynia
Cn2 (Nav1.6 activator) → dose-dependent spontaneous pain + mechanical allodynia + no cold or hot allodynia
4-AP (delay-rectifier channels inhibitor) → Triggers cold allodynia, reversed by GIIIA but not by TRPM8 or TRPA1 inhibition
4-AP (500 µM) + Cn2 (10 nM) → Increase of Cn2-triggered cold allodynia
articles.notes: Chez l'humain, 2.5-3.5 mg/kg d'oxalipl sont utilisés. Oxaliplatin is rapidly hydrolyzed in vivo to bioactive derivatives through displacement of the oxalate group by H2O and Cl− to produce oxalate as well as reactive monochloro-, dichloro- and diaquo-diaminocyclohexane platinum metabolites. Nav1.8 et 1.9 sont des isoformes résistantes à la TTX. Nav1.3, 1.7, 1.1, 1.2, 1.6 sont sensibles à la TTX. CCLU : activation of Nav1.6 per se produced only spontaneous pain and mechanical allodynia, but when combined with inhibition of delayed rectifier potassium channels could enhance cold allodynia

articles.title: Activation mechanism of the mouse cold-sensing TRPM8 channel by cooling agonist and PIP2
results: PIP2 binding site identified in TRPM8
Cold and agonist binding sites mapped
Mechanism of TRPM8 activation elucidated
articles.notes: Article fondamental sur le mécanisme d'activation de TRPM8

articles.title: TRPM8 Activation by Menthol, Icilin, and Cold Is Differentially Modulated by Intracellular pH
results: Activation of TRPM8 by icilin and cold, but not menthol, is modulated by intracellular pH in the physiological range
Activation by icilin and cold involve a different mechanism to activation by menthol
articles.notes: Activation TRPM8 par icilin est delayée par rapport à activation par menthol

articles.title: Chemotherapy for pain: reversing inflammatory and neuropathic pain with the anticancer agent mithramycin A
models: DRG from C57Bl/6 male and female mice
results: Mithramycine A → reverse inflammation-induced (by CFA) and cisplatin-induced heat and mechanical hypersens + reverse oxal-induced cold and mechanical hypersens + reverse oxal-induced TRPM8 overexpression + decreases nb of DRG responding to cold after oxal treatment + reverse oxal-induced ROS increase in DRG
Oxal → Gros changement transcriptionnels dans DRG + ROS increase in DRG
articles.notes: Mithramycin A (MTT) = agent chimio, inhibiteur de Sp-1-like transcription factors, lesquels régulent l'expression de TRPV1, A1, M8 dans DRG. Idée de douleurs acute ou persistent est prise en compte dans article. Profils d'expression de gènes liés à la douleur dans DRG après oxal !

articles.title: Structure-Based Design of Novel Biphenyl Amide Antagonists of Human Transient Receptor Potential Cation Channel Subfamily M Member 8 Channels with Potential Implications in the Treatment of Sensory Neuropathies
results: Développement d'antagonistes TRPM8 pour la clinique
articles.notes: Il n'y a pour l'instant aucun antagoniste de TRPM8 utilisé en clinique

articles.title: In Vitro Pain Assay Using Human iPSC-Derived Sensory Neurons and Microelectrode Array
results: Proposent iPSC-derived sensory neurons comme modèle pour CIPN
articles.notes: Nouveau modèle in vitro pour étudier la CIPN

articles.title: Oxaliplatin Depolarizes the IB4− Dorsal Root Ganglion Neurons to Drive the Development of Neuropathic Pain Through TRPM8 in Mice
models: DRG dissociated from adult male C57BL/6 mice
results: Resting membrane potential IB4+ DRG ≈ -45 mV
Resting membrane potential IB4- DRG ≈ -50 mV
Oxal (acute, 50 μM) → IB4- neurons depolarization and decrease of Cm (ie increased excitability) (15-60min after oxal) but no IB4+ depol
Oxal (3-4 days after unique ip injection, 5mg/kg) → Mechanical and cold but no heat allodynia or motor impairment
Retigabine (Kv7 opener that hyperpolarizes DRG neurons resting potential) → prevents oxal-induced mecha allodynia, attenuates cold hyperalgesia + no impact on heat or motor behaviors
TC-I (TRPM8 blocker) or A-967079 (TRPA1 blocker) → prevent oxal-induced electrophysiological changes + TC-I but not A-967079 decreased mecha and cold hypersens
Capsazepine (TRPV1 blocker) → No prevention of oxal-induced electrophysiological changes
articles.notes: Très utile pour mon sujet !!! TRPM8 n'est pas exprimé dans neurones IB4+. Les résultats trouvés ici ne sont pas observés par d'autres études, mais ici on est en patch perforé (amphotericine B) et non en WC classique. La perforation de la membrane plasmique au niveau de la pipette empêche les échanges de gros ions divalents et autres molécules entre le milieu intracell et la pipette. Le patch perforé grâce à l'amphotericine permet donc de maintenir la dynamique calcique intracellulaire sans influence de l'EGTA (Ca2+ chelator) inclus dans la pipette. TRPM8-mediated membrane depolarization plays a critical role in oxaliplatin-induced mecha and cold sensitivity

articles.title: Pharmacological blockade of TRPM8 ion channels alters cold and cold pain responses in mice
results: TRPM8 blockade affects cold and cold pain responses
articles.notes: Étude des effets du blocage pharmacologique de TRPM8

articles.title: L type Ca2+ channel blockers prevent oxaliplatin-induced cold hyperalgesia and TRPM8 overexpression in rats
results: L-type Ca2+ channel blockers prevent oxaliplatin-induced cold hyperalgesia and TRPM8 overexpression
articles.notes: Rôle des canaux Ca2+ de type L dans l'hyperalgésie au froid induite par l'oxaliplatine

articles.title: Sex-related differences in oxaliplatin-induced changes in the expression of transient receptor potential channels and their contribution to cold hypersensitivity
results: Sex differences in TRP channel expression changes after oxaliplatin treatment
Different contribution to cold hypersensitivity between sexes
articles.notes: Étude des différences sexuelles dans les effets de l'oxaliplatine

articles.title: In Vitro and In Vivo Pharmacological Characterization of a Novel TRPM8 Inhibitor Chemotype Identified by Small-Scale Preclinical Screening
results: Identification and characterization of new TRPM8 inhibitors
articles.notes: Établissement de nouveaux antagonistes de TRPM8

articles.title: Rational Design of a Modality-Specific Inhibitor of TRPM8 Channel against Oxaliplatin-Induced Cold Allodynia
results: Development of a modality-specific TRPM8 inhibitor that inhibits ligand activation but not cold activation
articles.notes: Établissement de nouveaux antagonistes de TRPM8. Celui-ci inhibe l'activation avec ligand mais pas avec froid (modality-specific)

articles.title: Exploration of TRPM8 Binding Sites by β‑Carboline-Based Antagonists and Their In Vitro Characterization and In Vivo Analgesic Activities
results: Characterization of β-carboline-based TRPM8 antagonists
In vivo analgesic effects demonstrated
articles.notes: Étude antagonistes de TRPM8

articles.title: β-Lactam TRPM8 Antagonist RGM8-51 Displays Antinociceptive Activity in Different Animal Models
results: RGM8-51 shows antinociceptive activity in various pain models
articles.notes: Nouveau β-lactame antagoniste de TRPM8 avec activité antinociceptive

articles.title: β-Lactam TRPM8 Antagonists Derived from Phe-Phenylalaninol Conjugates: Structure-Activity Relationships and Antiallodynic Activity
results: Structure-activity relationships of β-lactam TRPM8 antagonists
Antiallodynic activity demonstrated
articles.notes: Même équipe que article 63

articles.title: Low-level laser therapy alleviates mechanical and cold allodynia induced by oxaliplatin administration in rats
models: Adult male S-D rats (oxal 4mg/kg, i.p., 4 jours tous les 3 jours)
results: Oxal → mecha & cold allodynia, menthol hypersens + Increased TRPM8 and NGF prot lvl + Increase SP level
LLTT → reduce oxal-induced allodynia and menthol-evoked nocifensive behaviors + reverse TRPM8 and NGF increase + Reduce SP lvl
articles.notes: Effet thérapeutique de la thérapie laser de bas niveau sur l'allodynie induite par l'oxaliplatine

articles.title: Analgesic Effects of Transcutaneous Ultrasound Nerve Stimulation in a Rat Model of Oxaliplatin-Induced Mechanical Hyperalgesia and Cold Allodynia
results: Ultrasound stimulation reduces oxaliplatin-induced mechanical hyperalgesia and cold allodynia
articles.notes: Étude des effets analgésiques de la stimulation ultrasonique transcutanée

articles.title: Identification of a Potent Tryptophan-Based TRPM8 Antagonist With in Vivo Analgesic Activity
results: Identification of a potent tryptophan-based TRPM8 antagonist
Demonstration of in vivo analgesic activity
articles.notes: Identification antagoniste TRPM8

articles.title: Oxaliplatin-induced changes in expression of transient receptor potential channels in the dorsal root ganglion as a neuropathic mechanism for cold hypersensitivity
results: Overexpression of TRPA1, TRPV1, and TRPM8 in DRG after oxaliplatin treatment
articles.notes: Apparemment (repris d'un autre article), on a une surexpression de A1, V1 et M8 dans les DRG suite à traitement oxaliplatine

articles.title: Neuronal cell lines as model dorsal root ganglion neurons: A transcriptomic comparison
results: None of the cell lines displayed an expression profile consistent with specific subclasses of sensory neurons
articles.notes: Profils d'expression des GPCR et des canaux ioniques dans ces différentes cellules. Ils présentent beaucoup de marqueurs de DRG (fibres C, fibre mécanoceptrices…)

articles.title: Dissociation of Dorsal Root Ganglion Neurons Induces Hyperexcitability That Is Maintained by Increased Responsiveness to cAMP and cGMP
models: DRG de souris (soumis à compression in vivo ou non, isolés ou non du tissus environnant)
results: Compression ou isolement des DRG → Augmentation de leur excitabilité via activation soutenue des voies cAPM-PKA et cGMP-PKG
articles.notes: Étude de l'hyperexcitabilité des DRG après dissociation

articles.title: Chronic compression or acute dissociation of dorsal root ganglion induces cAMP-dependent neuronal hyperexcitability through activation of PAR2
models: DRG de souris (soumis à compression in vivo ou non, isolés ou non du tissus environnant)
results: DRG compression (CCD) or dissociation → PAR2 activation and cAPM-PKA signalling
articles.notes: Étude des mécanismes d'hyperexcitabilité des DRG via PAR2

articles.title: Sensory neuron downregulation of the Kv9.1 potassium channel subunit mediates neuropathic pain following nerve injury
models: Adult male Winstar rats with experimental neuropathy (section nerf L5)
results: Kv9.1 exprimé selectivement dans les neurones myélinisés de gros ou moyen diamètre, qui donnent principalement naissance aux fibres Aβ et Aδ, très peu exprimé dans les petits nocicepteurs peptidergiques ou non peptidergiques
Peripheral nerve injury → Kv9.1 downregulation dès les premières 24h suivant la chirurgie et presque plus exprimé à j3. Toujours dowregulated a j28
Dissociated DRG → Kv9.1 downregulation
Kv9.1 KO (by siRNA) → mechanical (but no heat) hyperalgesia + A-fibers hyperexcitability (increased spontaneous activity, PA de plus petite amplitude mais plus long)
articles.notes: three protein markers of neuronal subpopulations: NF200, which stains medium-large myelinated neurons; CGRP, present in small peptidergic nociceptors; and IB4, expressed in small nonpeptidergic nociceptors.

articles.title: Signs of neuropathic pain depend on signals from injured nerve fibers in a rat model
models: Sprague Dawley rats, ♂, with or without spinal nerve lesion or dorsal root rhizotomy (cutting)
results: L5-L6 nerve lesion → Heat and mechanical allodynia except if dorsal root was totally cut before
Cutting L5-L6 dorsal root → No heat or mecha allodynia
articles.notes: Montre qu'il n'y a des douleurs uniquement si lésion du nerf à distance du DRG, il n'y a plus de douleurs si le nerf lésé ne communique plus avec les DRG. Permet de dire que DRG sont impliqués dans douleur neuropathiques

articles.title: Contributions of injured and intact afferents to neuropathic pain in an experimental rat model
models: Neuropathic pain rats (S-D, male) model (ie L5-L6 spinal nerve ligation) with or without L5-L6 or L3-L4 dorsal rhizotomy
results: L5-L6 spinal nerve ligation → cold and mechanical allodynia
L5-L6 dorsal rhizotomy or local anaesthesia → Reverse L5-L6 ligation-induced allodynia within 24h
L3-L4 dorsal rhizotomy → Reversal of L5-L6 ligation-induced allodynia but no other paw stimulation elicited behavioral answer at this point (paw denervation)
articles.notes: Suite des recherches de l'article 73

articles.title: Transient receptor potential ankyrin 1 that is induced in dorsal root ganglion neurons contributes to acute cold hypersensitivity after oxaliplatin administration
models: Oxal single i.p. dose (1, 3 or 6 mg/kg)
results: Oxal (3-6mg/kg) → cold allodynia + increase TRPA1 mRNA expression (day 1) and protein lvl (day 2)
p38 MAPK inhibitor injection → decrease oxal-induced cold hypersens
articles.notes: Time course développement des douleurs et des changements d'expression. Etude de l'expression de A1 selon la morphologie des DRG, la présence d'IB4…

articles.title: Oxaliplatin-induced neurotoxicity involves TRPM8 in the mechanism of acute hypersensitivity to cold sensation
models: Patients atteints de cancer colorectal traités par oxaliplatine
techniques: Application de menthol sur la langue
results: Seuil de détection du froid : sain > oxal-treated advanced colorectal patients with grade 2 (or lower) neurotoxicity
Les patients traités à l'oxal détectent mieux le froid que les sujets sains, tant que la neurotoxicité n'est pas trop importante
articles.notes: Étude clinique sur l'hypersensibilité au froid induite par l'oxaliplatine

articles.title: Role of nerve growth factor-tyrosine kinase receptor A signaling in paclitaxel-induced peripheral neuropathy in rats
models: Rats SD traités par paclitaxel (ip, 8mg/kg, j0, 4, 7, 11)
results: Paclitaxel → increase NGF & NGF trkA receptor expression in DRG but not their mRNA lvls
articles.notes: Étude du rôle du NGF dans la neuropathie périphérique induite par le paclitaxel

articles.title: Goshajinkigan, a traditional Japanese medicine, prevents oxaliplatin-induced acute peripheral neuropathy by suppressing functional alteration of TRP channels in rat
results: Goshajinkigan prévient la neuropathie périphérique aiguë induite par l'oxaliplatine
articles.notes: Étude d'un médicament traditionnel japonais sur les effets de l'oxaliplatine

articles.title: Ca/Mg infusions for the prevention of oxaliplatin-related neurotoxicity in patients with colorectal cancer: a meta-analysis

articles.notes: Meta-analyse sur l'efficacité des infusions de Ca/Mg

articles.title: TRPA1 contributes to cold, mechanical, and chemical nociception but is not essential for hair-cell transduction

articles.title: TRPV1 in chronic pruritus and pain: Soft modulation as a therapeutic strategy
results: Review on TRPV1
articles.notes: Review on TRPV1

articles.title: Amplified Cold Transduction in Native Nociceptors by M-Channel Inhibition
results: Menthol decreases current at positive voltages in HEK cells transfected with Kv7.2/3 and TRPM8
TRPM8 inhibits M current through Kv7.2/3, increasing cold sensitivity and cell excitability
articles.notes: M-current = voltage-dependent potassium current (activation threshold ≈-50, -40 mV, below excitability threshold), IM increases with depolarization until ≈+50, +80 mV, current present in DRG and mainly passing through Kv7.2/3 (heteromer). Regulates resting potential, modulates excitability threshold. Role in nociception: participates in pain threshold establishment. Inhibition of this current leads to hyperexcitability and increased sensitivity.

articles.title: Variable Threshold of Trigeminal Cold-Thermosensitive Neurons Is Determined by a Balance between TRPM8 and Kv1 Potassium Channels
models: TG from neonatal (P1-P6) and adult OF1 mice, or adult TRPA1-/- mice
results: Fibers responding to non-painful and painful cold are different
These threshold differences depend on TRPM8 and Kv1 expression
Higher M8 density at membrane = lower cold detection threshold in TG (detects lower temperatures, higher cold sensitivity)
More Kv1 = less cold sensitivity
4-AP (K+ channel inhibitor, including Kv1.1 and 1.2) → increases cold sensitivity count in TRPA-/- mice
articles.notes: 4-AP inhibits several Kv channels, including: Kv1.4, Kv3.4, Kv4.1, Kv4.2, Kv4.3 (A-type Kv channels) and Kv1.1, Kv1.2, Kv1.6 (Delayed rectifier Kv channels)

articles.title: Bimodal Action of Menthol on the Transient Receptor Potential Channel TRPA1
results: Menthol (1-100µM) activates TRPA1
Menthol (1mM) inhibits TRPA1
articles.notes: Bimodal effect of menthol on TRPA1

articles.title: Menthol excites dural afferent neurons by inhibiting leak K+ conductance in rats
results: Menthol inhibits leak K+ channels, possibly acid-sensitive two-pore domain K+ channels, increasing nociceptive sensory neuron excitability
This effect would be independent of M8 (menthol current is not reversed by M8 antagonist)
articles.notes: Only abstract & section snippets, no pdf available for now. Generally, some channels are activated by cold but not by menthol; cold doesn't only activate M8, it also inhibits TREK-1 and TRAAK, K+ leak channels

articles.title: A TRP Channel that Senses Cold Stimuli and Menthol
results: Mouse TRPM8 sequence predicts 1104 amino acid protein
Mouse TRPM8 is 93% identical to human gene
TRPM8 mainly expressed in DRG, in 5-10% of DRG neurons (adult mouse)
Expressed in TrkA-dependent neurons, distinct from IB4+, CGRP+ and VR1 (ie TRPV1) neurons
articles.notes: EARLY ARTICLE ABOUT M8 (Patapoutian team). First time TRPM8 is named, first time it is cloned. Shows classic menthol response in CHO cells

articles.title: Cold transduction by inhibition of a background potassium conductance in rat primary sensory neurones
results: Cooling increased input resistance of all neurons, indicating inhibition of outward current active at resting potential rather than activation of inward current
Primary cause of depolarization and increased excitability induced by cooling appears to be inhibition of background K+ current active at resting potential
articles.notes: Generally, some channels are activated by cold but not by menthol; cold doesn't only activate M8, it inhibits TREK-1 and TRAAK, K+ leak channels

articles.title: Specificity of cold thermotransduction is determined by differential ionic channel expression
results: Cooling closes background K+ channel, causing depolarization and firing
In cold-insensitive neurons, firing is prevented by slow, transient, 4-AP-sensitive K+ current (IKD) that acts as excitability brake
Pharmacological blockade of IKD induced thermosensitivity in cold-insensitive neurons, may explain cold allodynia in neuropathic pain
articles.notes: Generally, some channels are activated by cold but not by menthol; cold doesn't only activate M8, it inhibits TREK-1 and TRAAK, K+ leak channels

articles.title: Inhibition of M current in sensory neurons by exogenous proteases: a signaling pathway mediating inflammatory nociception
results: PLC- and Ca(2+)/PIP(2)-mediated inhibition of M current in sensory neurons may represent one of general mechanisms underlying pain produced by inflammatory mediators
articles.notes: Interesting to link with TRPM8 modulations (PIP2) and ref 179 (M-current inhibition via Kv7.2/3 by menthol)

results: PDAC (KPC mice) → increased TRPA1 and TRPV1 expression
articles.notes: Expression changes in TRP channels in PDAC

Treated for 21 days and received 6 doses of FFX (twice/week)

articles.title: The action potential in mammalian central neurons
results: Contribution of particular currents to action potential can be dissected using action potential clamp technique
Shows where to measure different parameters on recording
articles.notes: Shows where to measure different parameters on recording. TO READ IN DETAIL

articles.title: Suppression of KV7/KCNQ potassium channel enhances neuronal differentiation of PC12 cells
results: Kv7.2 and 7.3 expressed in PC12 (more expressed in undifferentiated than differentiated)
articles.notes: Kv7 expression in PC12

articles.title: TRPM3 as a novel target to alleviate acute oxaliplatin-induced peripheral neuropathic pain
results: In vitro calcium microfluorimetry and whole-cell patch-clamp experiments showed that TRPM3 is functionally upregulated in both heterologous and homologous expression systems after acute (24 hours) oxaliplatin treatment, whereas direct application of oxaliplatin was without effect
articles.notes: Article with neuron sorting in BSA gradient

articles.title: High-throughput combined voltage-clamp/current-clamp analysis of freshly isolated neurons
results: About 10% success on DRG in automatic patch
articles.notes: Success rate for automatic patch on DRG

articles.title: Enhanced excitability of dissociated primary sensory neurons after chronic compression of the dorsal root ganglion in the rat
results: DRG dissociation → Increase Rin & more positive RMP (compared to intact DRG) in small but not medium or big neurons
articles.notes: Comparison of neuronal excitability after DRG dissociation VS intact DRG. + Effect of chronic compression on excitability

articles.title: Cutaneous and Colonic Rat DRG Neurons Differ With Respect to Both Baseline and PGE2-Induced Changes in Passive and Active Electrophysiological Properties
results: Average Cm for cutaneous DRG = 33.2 +/- 1.1 pF (range 20.34-42 pF, n=33)
PGE2 (inflammatory mediator prostaglandin E2) → Increase excitability of cutaneous DRG (decreased rheobase + increase in AP frequency in response to suprathreshold stimulation)
articles.notes: Explains well AP analysis. Membrane capacitance measured in whole cell configuration is accurate measure of cell body size, used to distinguish small from large neurons with cut-off of 42 pF

articles.title: An improved method for patch clamp recording and calcium imaging of neurons in the intact dorsal root ganglion in rats
results: DRG neurons have resting potential of −54 ± 2 mV and input resistance of 345 ± 40 M (n=18)
articles.notes: Resting membrane potential and input resistance in intact DRG

articles.title: Fast-Slow Analysis as a Technique for Understanding the Neuronal Response to Current Ramps
results: Although this is informative, jump in applied current is artificial
More physiological input is where applied current is ramped up, reflecting chemosensory input
Neurons can respond differently to the two protocols
articles.notes: About way to analyze ramp protocols for AP studies and about why current ramps protocols are more physiological than current steps

articles.title: Whole‑cell patch‑clamp recording and parameters
results: Guidelines for patch-clamp recording
articles.notes: Useful for interns (M2 level), good explanations except for pressure positive or negative that are inversed on our system

articles.title: Control of somatic membrane potential in nociceptive neurons and its implications for peripheral nociceptive transmission
results: RMP DRG ≈ -60 mV, whether in WC, perforated patch or sharp electrode
articles.notes: Focus on identification of channels responsible for maintaining resting potential in DRG

articles.title: A cold- and menthol-activated current in rat dorsal root ganglion neurones: properties and role in cold transduction
results: Shows figures of AP in DRG cold-sensitive neurons vs not cold-sensitive
Other information in discussion about current signature in cold-sensitive or not neurons
articles.notes: AP analysis in cold-sensitive vs non-sensitive neurons

articles.title: Paclitaxel in vitro reversibly sensitizes the excitability of IB4(−) and IB4(+) sensory neurons from male and female rats
results: Paclitaxel strongly and reversibly stimulated spontaneous activity and augmented action potential tonic firing in IB4(−) and IB4(+) neurons in both sexes, peaking at 48h post‐treatment and virtually disappearing at 96h
Paclitaxel decreased current rheobase for action potential firing by reducing and accelerating after‐hyperpolarization phase
Molecularly, paclitaxel modulated Na+ and K+ ion currents
Particularly, drug significantly augmented function of Nav1.8, TRPV1 and TRPM8 channels
Furthermore, paclitaxel increased Nav1.8 and TRPV1 expression at 48h post‐treatment
Notably, female DRG neurons appear more sensitive to paclitaxel sensitization than male counterparts
articles.notes: Sex differences in paclitaxel effects

articles.title: Quantitative differences in neuronal subpopulations between mouse and human dorsal root ganglia demonstrated with RNAscope in situ hybridization
results: Comparison of mouse vs human DRG
articles.notes: Comparison between mouse and human DRG

articles.title: Atypical changes in DRG neuron excitability and complex pain phenotype associated with a Nav1.7 mutation that massively hyperpolarizes activation
results: For small diameter DRG
Rin: 513 ± 47 MOhm
Rheobase: 106 ± 2.2 pA
Half-width: 4.97 ± 0.42
Afterhyperpol potential: -64.5 ± 1.3
articles.notes: Electrophysiological parameters in small DRG neurons
